availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Covington merchant. Virginia native. Widower. Father of Nevilla Timberlake. Partner in Timberlake W. D. F. & Co. in Covington in 1861.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 4, p. 265. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 2, p. 104. G. W. Hawes, G. W. Hawes’ Commercial Gazetteer and Business Directory of the Ohio River, Embracing the Towns, Cities and Villages on the River from Pittsburg, Pennsylvania, to Cairo, Illinois, with an Extensive Classification (Indianapolis, IN: G. W. Hawes, 1861), p. 439, 442. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, p. 6. “William D. F. Timberlake,” Find A Grave, March 7, 2012, memorial no. 86395379. KYR-0001-020-0588.
